content: <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>City and County of Denver, Department of Environmental Health </origin>         <pubdate>20110615</pubdate>         <title> South Platte River Glide Sites</title>         <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract>Location of Department of Environmental Health (DEH) in-stream sampling locations along the South Platte River and are based on macroinvertebrate sampling performed from 1996-2003. These desginations apply only to locations that are designated as "glide" sites. This is a subset of those sites listed in the ENV_BENTHICSITES_P layer.</abstract>       <purpose>To indicate the locations of the glides along the South Platte River.</purpose>       <supplinf>*These sites were entered prior to 2003 and have not been updated. Stream renovations may have impacted precise location of sampling sites, but the general location will still be accurate. There are additional in-stream monitoring sites that are not included in this layer.   Glide Macrohabitat - Water moving slowly, with a smooth, unbroken surface.  Low turbulence.</supplinf>     </descript>     <timeperd>       <timeinfo>         <sngdate>           <caldate>unknown</caldate>         </sngdate>       </timeinfo>       <current>ground condition</current>     </timeperd>     <status>       <progress>Complete</progress>       <update>None planned</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>-105.016043</westbc>         <eastbc>-104.969475</eastbc>         <northbc>39.790367</northbc>         <southbc>39.660942</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>     <keywords>       <theme>         <themekt>None</themekt>         <themekey>water quality</themekey>       </theme>       <theme>         <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Categories</themekt>         <themekey>biota</themekey>         <themekey>environment</themekey>         <themekey>health</themekey>         <themekey>inlandWaters</themekey>       </theme>       <place>         <placekt>None</placekt>         <placekey>Denver</placekey>         <placekey>Denver County</placekey>         <placekey>Colorado</placekey>         <placekey>USA</placekey>       </place>       <stratum>         <stratkt>None</stratkt>         <stratkey>Terrestrial Surface</stratkey>       </stratum>     </keywords>     <accconst>None</accconst>     <useconst>ACCESS CONSTRAINTS:   None. <attrlabl>GLOBALID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>A field of type UUID (Universal Unique Identifier) in which values are automatically assigned by the geodatabase when a row is created. The GlobalID field is necessary for maintaining object uniqueness across replicas. All feature classes and tables participating in one-way or two-way replication must contain the GlobalID field. This field is not editable and is automatically populated when it is added for existing data. </attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>       </attr>     </detailed>   </eainfo>   <distinfo>     <distrib>       <cntinfo>         <cntorgp>           <cntorg>City and County of Denver, Technology Services / Denver GIS Data</cntorg>         </cntorgp>         <cntaddr>           <addrtype>unknown</addrtype>           <address>201 W Colfax Ave, Dept 301</address>           <city>Denver</city>           <state>CO</state>           <postal>80202</postal>           <country>USA</country>         </cntaddr>         <cntfax>720-913-5237 </cntfax>         <cntemail>denvergis@denvergov.org</cntemail>         <hours> M-F 8:00am - 4:30pm (MT)</hours>       </cntinfo>     </distrib>     <distliab>See access and use constraints information.</distliab>   </distinfo>   <metainfo>     <metd>20130606</metd>     <metstdn>FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata</metstdn>     <metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998</metstdv>     <mettc>local time</mettc>   </metainfo> </metadata>
